items.sentence: It's hard to believe that Tom really wants to do that.
Hey, Tom. I've got something I think you ought to see.
Tell Tom to call me tomorrow at 2:30 in the afternoon.
The food at that restaurant wasn't all that delicious.
Where did you buy that hat you were wearing yesterday?
Even if that were true, what difference would it make?
Tom wasn't able to figure out how to get the box open.
We've lost way too much money trying to change things.
Tom thought about it and realized that Mary was right.
I'll try to keep Tom from leaving before you get here.
Tom not only ate his dessert, he also ate Mary's, too.
I've been living in this house for about thirty years.
The last time I was sick, I was in bed for three days.
Tell me that I'm not the only one who saw this coming.
I may be old and ugly, but I'm still smarter than you.
I don't think that you and I can do that by ourselves.
I thought that we were supposed to eat lunch together.
I'm not the one who took out the garbage this morning.
I have no idea what the weather will be like tomorrow.
That's not the main reason Tom didn't want to do that.
